title: Study links old volcano eruption to start of Black Death in Europe
snippets: Though its route through Central Asia remains elusive, two German researchers believe they have discovered how — and why — the plague made it to Medieval Europe.
Climate data and historical accounts suggest that crop failures in the 1340s prompted Italian officials to import grain from eastern Europe, and this may have carried in the plague bacterium
A volcanic eruption in 1345 may have kicked off a series of events that led to the Black Death sweeping through medieval Europe.

New research suggests that volcanic eruptions may have triggered climate cooling and famine that pushed Italian city-states to import grain from the Black Sea—unknowingly bringing plague-infected fleas with it. The findings are based on climate data and historical records.

title: Jahmyr Gibbs scores three touchdowns as Lions beat Cowboys
snippets: Jahmyr Gibbs ran for three touchdowns as the Detroit Lions stayed in the playoff hunt with a much-needed 44-30 win over the Dallas Cowboys on Thursday night.
Highlights from the Week 14 matchup between the Dallas Cowboys and the Detroit Lions during the 2025 NFL season.

DETROIT — Jahmyr Gibbs and a defence that suddenly generated pressure and turnovers helped the Detroit Lions stay in contention for a playoff berth. Gibbs ran for three touchdowns, including a 13-yarder with 2:19 left that sealed the Lions’ much-needed 44-30 win over the Dallas Cowboys on Thursday night. The Lions sacked Dak Prescott five times — a week after they had no sacks and lost to Green Bay — and had two interceptions and recovered a fumble. “You could see an uptick in urgency from everybody,” Jared Goff said. The Lions (8-5) avoided losing consecutive games for the first time in more...
titles: Gibbs inspires Lions past Cowboys with hat-trick of touchdowns
Highlights: Cowboys @ Lions
Gibbs rushes for three touchdowns, Lions get much-needed win over Cowboys
constructiveness_reason: semantic: pos_sim=0.00, neg_sim=0.00; length_penalty=0.35 (<12 tokens)
summary: Jahmyr Gibbs scored three rushing touchdowns as the Detroit Lions defeated the Dallas Cowboys 44-30 on Thursday night, improving their record to 8-5 in the 2025 NFL season. The Lions' defense contributed with five sacks, two interceptions, and a fumble recovery. The win keeps Detroit in the playoff hunt and prevents them from losing consecutive games.
